title: How to study for C programming (2nd sem)
content: C was my worst performance in ISA 1 and I'm trying to do better in the upcoming ISA 2 and ESA, but I feel that the way I'm studying is inneficient. I keep coding but I often struggle with logic and that puts me off. I dont know how to go about it at this point. Any advice?

comments.body:
Instead of letting it put you off, make a habit of self humiliation when you fail. 

Failing has been punished and thought of as the worst thing in the world mainly due to the Indian education system. It is not. It's what makes you stronger. Instead of going 'ah shit I can't get this thing too while the others are', go 'ah shit I'm an idiot, anyways, what's next?' 

I'm not telling you to criticize yourself but to have a light heart about it. Failing isn't bad. 

Keep coding mate, you're on the right path! 

If it helps, I've made C notes while I was in my first sem and many people have reported it to be very helpful. Let me know if you want them, I'll be happy to send you a link

Please do send the link, it would be of great help.

Thank you!
